intro: Hebradendron ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hebradendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants known for their economic and medicinal importance.
